revised_title: The Role of Air and Neutral Salts in Enhancing Blood Color
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand how common air and neutral salts affect the color of blood. They found that these substances do not change the color of the blood's red matter but can make black blood appear more florid. The author explains this phenomenon using the theories of Kepler, Zucchi, and Delaval, which suggest that the color of a substance depends on the light that is reflected from its internal parts.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Physiology
